reviews.review_msg: Cecile was a great prof who taught an interesting course. It's obvious she loves what she teaches. The only issue with her is that she has a tendency to ramble. So be prepared to get easily bored in her classes as she goes on and on about a small country that proves the weekly topic she's teaching.

I was worried of taking Cécile because of the mixed reviews, but she's absolutely lovely ! She's very sweet, gentle and always listens to what you have to say. As a prof, I enjoyed the way she carried the course; she wanted her students to learn and showcase it, not memorize information to ace tests for the purpose of a good grade.

Such a lovely person. Is someone I could sit and talk with for hours. Is so passionate about her field, and really wanted us to learn. Her weakness is being semi-disorganized and her lectures feeling like tangents, at parts. The course is easy, as exams are just information-memorization task, so it is extremely feasible to earn an A grade.

I had a horrible experience with this prof. She said one thing and did another for certain students. I would not take this course again. Her grading criteria was clear but her expectations were not. She is a hard grader and strict about using phones in class.

Cécile is an amazing professor! She is very passionate and intelligent. If you are struggling, ask her for help before it's too late, because if you're respectful, she's very approachable and helpful. We love you, Cécile!

Cécile's expectations for the class are not high, pretty standard for a 3XX level university course. This is not your 2XX level grammar regurgitating the facts french course, you need to critically think. She truly wants you to succeed so just put in a little effort and you'll be golden (especially if you've taken a course with a research paper).

Cécile is an amazing person and is passionate about her area of study. However, she is very conceited and often presents her theories as absolute facts, making it difficult for me to respect what she says. On top of this, she has very unrealistic expectations. More than half of the class failed the midterm badly, and she is often cruel to those who

She is very smart and honestly very inspirational! However despite attending lectures, doing the assigned work, and actively participating you aren't guaranteed a good grade. Half the class including myself failed the midterm, and she said before we started writing it that it would be easy. I didn't know how to succeed in her class which is a shame

I wouldn't wish her on my worst enemy. She's unbelievably vague with her criteria, so if you want to do well, make sure to ask her a LOT of questions about assignments. She expects an absolutely insane amount of reading for each class and then barely touches on the topic of the readings. She is disinterested, and dismissive & rude toward students.

This will be my first & last class with her. She was pretty rude maybe that is the french "way" but I could not stand it. She called students out with little regard for their feelings. Not to say we should be babied but there are nicer ways to talk to people. I am doing well in the class but DO NOT like her. WARNING. be careful with her

Took 330 with her, SOOOO much reading. Each week had around 3-4 50+ articles that would rarely get discussed in class. Her marking was super hard and often made students feel really stupid. Ended up doing okay in the class but made me question my ability in french. Office hours are super useful. WOULD NOT take another class with her.

I dreaded this class every week, content was okay but not interactive. There is an insane amount of reading for every week. She definitely knows her stuff, which made me feel like anything I said was wrong. She wasn't so bad, but I wouldn't take her again. Shows favouritism. People who took this class with another prof enjoyed the class, I didn't!

Although I really enjoyed talking with Cecile, and thoroughly enjoyed her lectures, I have never had so many assignments in my entire life. She doesn't just take marks off for grammatical mistakes but if you don't express yourself in a way that fits her own personal style, making it hard to do well and succeed in this class.
Just did not seem to care about the students at all. Marking schemes on some of the tests were ridiculous. Would not take a class with her again.

She was my  INSPIRATION with her passion about Sociolinguistics. if you want to see the world from a totally different perspective SHE is the ONE. She expects the students to be ready for discussions which requires a lot of reading. Besides of her teaching abilities she is a world known researcher, she publishes lots of articles unlike other profs.
Thanks for your teaching Ms. vigouroux. I wish to have you again as a professor !

One of my favourite professors--extremely knowledgeable, willing to help, organized, fair marker, passionate about her work. I liked how she wasn't afraid to adjust the syllabus when students asked interesting questions that required more explanation and discussion. Will definitely take more of her courses.
Great class and great teacher!! Very straightforward.. if you study for the exams you will do extremely well. Very easy class to do well in with a bit of effort!!

Cécile seems very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject matter.She is a captivating teacher and explains things well.She does have an almost "mocking way" to answer questions sometimes,which make students hesitant to ask some.Her tests are very fair/straightforward,but you definitely have to spend a time studying & understand the subject.

She is one of the most helpful profs I have ever had. She is very knowledgeable and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Attendance is mandatory and there are a lot of article to read but she is very straightforward. She is intimidating, but if you ask for help she will do everything she can.
Nice, gives good letures and willing to help anytime.  I recommend her for ling classes.
Totallly willing to help anytime... Tests weren't too hard but make sure u read the materials.  Ask her for help if you don't understand.
She is wonderful. Always there for you, ready to help and answer to all questions you have!
Her interest level in the course material is high, and she welcomes questions (if you're brave enough to ask them) I found her to be a bit belittling.

She is inspiring. Her enthusiasm for the topics she teaches is contagious. Rather than considering her students as empty boxes one must fill with knowledge she guides them to think to ask questions and to find their own answers. Thats what makes her classes so challenging. But whenever she sees the effort she is generous with grades...

She is fantastic. Very approachable, however I can see how students with a lower level of french would feel intimidated. She is a lovely lady to talk to and very intelligent. She is very willing to give extra help when you are sick and interested in her subject. I never felt like she didn't want to be there, so that was nice! A+ :-)

Cecil is one of the worst teachers I?ve had in university. Her teaching skills are extremely poor, she intimidates the class into being afraid to ask questions, and her marking scheme is very unfair, she blamed the class for doing poorly on the midterm. I would never take another class with her.

Kind of intimidating.  She is a very confident speaker, but she is also very clear and makes a big effort to be sure that the whole class is following.  I would definitely take a class with her again!

I had Cecile a year and a half ago. I found her to be very intimidating, but after I finished with my major, I realized that she was one of the best Profs I've had. In her office she is a very different person-Very nice, funny, and honest. She has very high expectations which is what I truly appreciated in the end.Not my best mark, but my best prof

Cecile definitely treats her students like they're stupid.  She gives you a condescendingly smirk when you're giving a dumb answer.  She doesn't allow room for mistakes. I wouldn't want to have her again.

She is knowlegeable and took extra efforts to ensure that students understand concepts covered in class. Though I find her at times difficult to approach, and the manner in which she conducts class discussions to be somewhat intimidating (typical French), my experience with her was good. I would take another course with her, just not in linguistics

Not a great prof. Not really approachable, always feels like you're disturbing her or maye, she is just not in a good mood that day? Seems to enjoy showing off her intellect and seems at times to think students are stupid. Easy marker though.

Cecile is a truly excellent professor, I have taken 370 plus 2 other 400 level linguitics classes with her, she is very intelligent. If you are having trouble in the class, go talk to her she is very receptive to questions, comments, etc. Very nice woman, very encouraging. She has high expectations, I love this about her!!! She's fair!!

While she is a nice prof and wants to help you out (esp. if you go to her office hours) she is ridiculous all the same. her exam was much too late in the semester and too hard. we basically knew our first mark  with a week left before the final. she's late in handing back assignments and is very hard but a fair  marker. expect to be confused
Cécile is very helpful. She is an amazing prof. She has passion in the subject and makes her classes fun to attend.
i like profs who listen to students' suggestions and comments,and cecile happens to be one of them. she's approachable and helpful. she also improves a lot the way she teaches.

at first I was very confused, but when the midterm and final rolled around, I aced them. very approchable and friendly, always available for extra help. if you attend lecture every class, you should have no problem

Passionate and powerful, I highly recommend taking FREN 370 with Dr Vigouroux. She may seem intimidating at first and hard to approach because of her strong character and intelligence, but in fact, she's the friendliest prof ever. She's never hesitant to answer oddly formulated questions and is very open-minded.
classes are very confusing and sometimes incomprehensible. however, she is a very easy marker and if you attend every lecture, you should have no problem acing the final
Contradictory and confusing in class. Although the average on the midterm was low (62%), she graded fairly. if you attend every class and take notes, you shouldnt have any problems.
notes were messy. sometimes hard to follow in class. helpful if u go to her office hours or email her. assignments helped get a better insight of the course. the midterm was a bit too long.

Her notes were all over the place and no one knew what to expect for the midterm. Most people failed, an average of 47%!!!! Obviously something wrong there... Was her first semester teaching in Canada...
 She is quite rude, always says no to your in class answers.
 Tip: Read HER review notes online and SKIP the additional sources.
